author: William Shakespeare
quote: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Frailty, thy name is woman!

author: William Shakespeare
quote: This above all: to thine own self be true.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Give me that man that is not passion's slave, and I will wear him in my heart's core, ay, in my heart of heart.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The lady doth protest too much, methinks.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: To thine own self be true, and it must follow, as the night the day, thou canst not then be false to any man.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Out, out brief candle! Life's but a walking shadow.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Fair is foul, and foul is fair.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Blood will have blood.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Things bad begun make strong themselves by ill.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: What's done is done.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The night is long that never finds the day.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Give sorrow words. The grief that does not speak whispers the o'erfraught heart and bids it break.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Thus with a kiss I die.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The more I give to thee, the more I have, for both are infinite.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: O, she doth teach the torches to burn bright!

author: William Shakespeare
quote: These violent delights have violent ends.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny, but in ourselves.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Parting is such sweet sorrow.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: I am not what I am.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The robbed that smiles, steals something from the thief.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Good name in man and woman is the immediate jewel of their souls.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: For that I do suspect the lusty Moor hath leaped into my seatâ€”the thought whereof doth, like a poisonous mineral, gnaw my inwards.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Et tu, Brute?

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The evil that men do lives after them; The good is oft interred with their bones.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: We are such stuff as dreams are made on, and our little life is rounded with a sleep.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Be not afeard; the isle is full of noises.
